THE PRE-INCARNATE EXISTENCE OF THE SON
The scripture says that, “No man has seen God, at any time. The only begotten Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, he has declared Him” (John 1:18) If no man has seen God at any time, then who appeared in various manifestations as YHWH to men of old?
Who did Adam walk with in the garden?
Who led the children of Israel through the wilderness?
Who was it that was known as YHWH and appeared and spoke with men before Yeshua’s incarnation?
All creation was brought into being by the Son, the Word (Col.1:15-16), and it was the Son who was in the Garden with Adam (Gen.2:8) John the apostle identifies Yeshua the Messiah as the Word of Yahweh who took on flesh as a human tabernacle "In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. He was in the beginning with God. All things came into being through it, and separately from Him not even one thing came into being that has come into being. And the Word became flesh, and tabernacled among us, and we beheld His glory, glory as of the only begotten from the Father, full of grace and truth." (John 1:1-3; 14)
This was not a new concept. He was known as the “Word” prior to His incarnation because He expressed the mind and will of the Father. It was something that was already understood - that YHWH God had a representation of Himself in the form of His Son who was manifested on His behalf and was called “the Word”, or as it is called in Aramaic, “the Memra”; and later known as the “Holy One of Israel”.
In the Aramaic Targums (from the second Temple period) where Yahweh is manifested in human-like appearance, the texts have replaced Yahweh with: "Yahweh's Word". - i.e. Yahweh’s "Memra".
In his pre-carnate existence He was also known as His Son (Hebrews 1:8-9): “Who has ascended into heaven, or descended? ...
“What is His Name and what is His Son’s Name, if you know?” (Prov.30:4). See also Proverbs 8 - & verses 30-31
“But thou, Bethlehem Ephratah, though you be little among the thousands of Judah, yet out of you shall he come forth unto me that is to be ruler in Israel; whose goings forth have been from of old, from everlasting.” (Micah 5:2)
Yeshua Himself said, “Most assuredly I say to you, before Abraham was, I am" (John 8: 58); and that Abraham rejoiced to see His day (John 8:56)
Many of the early Church fathers wrote concerning Yeshua's deity on the understanding that He was the Son who had manifested to the children of Israel before His incarnation. Gregory of Nyssa (240 AD) says it very explicitly, identifying Yehsua the Messiah as the One whom Moses encountered on the mount. “Christ Jesus was so bright that Moses could not look upon Him. He was an object of dread to the cherubim, also to the seraphim and His throne blazed in splendour"
The Israelites beheld the Angel of Yahweh (the Son) who led them, as well as His Presence (holy Spirit) in the pillar of cloud that rested upon them. We see the two mentioned in Exodus 14:19 - note verse 24. Note also where He says that He will not go up with them but will only send His Angel (the Angel of Yahweh - i.e. the Son - Exodus 33:1-3)
Although he was sometimes called the “Angel of Yahweh”, he was not of an angelic order (Hebrews 1:5-6) The Father can’t be seen by man and so He sent His Son who was begotten of Him.
Paul identified this One as “Christ”, their Messiah (1 Cor.10:4). So, if it was the Son of God who led them and manifested himself to them then, and at other times, that Being could not be termed “God” because they saw him and no man has seen God at any time, nor can man see God and live. (﻿Ex. 33:20; Judges 13:22) Take note: that in these manifestations he was not limited to the state of humanity as he was in his incarnation and yet he is still not referred to as “God”. He was representing the Father and speaking on behalf of Him.
HIS REPRESENTATION OF THE FATHER
In His incarnation Yeshua came in His Father’s Name (John 5:43). In His manifestations prior to that there is an even stronger representation of the Father with little or no attention at all on His own identity.
There are many occasions where He speaks for the Father, on His behalf as a complete stand-in for the Father. Then there are the appearances to men like Gideon (Judges 6:11-12) where he addressed the Angel of Yahweh as if it were YHWH Himself (6:22-24). As also to Samson’s parents (Judges 13:3,6, 9,13, 16-22).
In both cases they recognised that they had “seen God" and lived. They had seen His manifestation in the Son.
On other occasions we see two persons identified as“Yahweh.
In Genesis 19:1, it says: "The two angels came to Sodom in the evening." The word ‘angels' (malachim), means "messengers" or "ambassadors". Therefore we do not know from the word itself if it is speaking of people from the earth or angels from heaven. The context determines the meaning. After the two angelic messengers went on to Sodom, Yahweh returned to Abraham and revealed to him His purposes regarding Sodom.
"And the men turned from there, and went toward Sodom; but Abraham stood yet before Yahweh. And Abraham drew near, and said: 'Would You also destroy the righteous with the wicked?" (Genesis 18:22-23) Abraham addressed the physical manifestation of God who stood before him as "Yahweh" - the Word. Then, "When He had finished talking to Abraham Yahweh went away, and Abraham returned home."(18:33)
Yahweh said to Abraham that he would go down to Sodom to see if it was really according to the outcry that had come before Him (18:21). The two angels then went down to Sodom with the authority of Yahweh to save Lot and carry out the heavenly judgement. (19:12-13)
Yahweh goes from speaking with Abraham to speak with Lot whom we may assume is the one who had been raising an outcry against the city (18:20-21; 2 Peter 2:7, 8) When Lot petitions Him to only go as far as Zoar before the judgement, Yahweh answers him, "Hurry, escape there,, because I cannot do anything until you reach it."(19:22)
"Then the LORD (YHWH) rained down burning sulphur on Sodom and Gomorrah, from the LORD (YHWH) out of the heavens." (19:24) Note the two YHWH’s referenced in the verse.
The Targum of Johnathan reads "Then Yahweh's Word rained down burning sulphur on Sodom and Amorah - from Yahweh out of the heavens." Both Abraham and Lot had a face to face encounter with a manifestation of Yahweh in fleshly form.
According to Yerushalayim's Targum it was to the Memra (the Word) that Abraham prayed "And Avraham worshipped and prayed in Yahweh's Word's name, and said: 'You are Yahweh, who sees me, but You cannot be seen'" Note that Avraham prays prays in Yahweh's Word's name, but he prays to the Yahweh who cannot be seen. Here there are two 'Yahwehs' that he is identifying - the One in whose Name he prays to the One to Whom he is praying This whole account in scripture reveals that there are two Yahweh's, one who called down fire and brimstone while on the earth, from the other who was in heaven sending it. Note that Abraham was able to look upon the face of God and not die. The Yahweh which Abraham saw was the pre incarnate Son of God.
In Isaiah 43:10-12 we have YHWH speaking of Israel as His chosen people and of His promised salvation. In verse 1 & 3, the Son is speaking. He is the “holy One of Israel”. In verse 11, it is both the Father.and the Son speaking - the Son is speaking on behalf of the Father in the Father’s name, “Yahweh”, which is done as part of their operation in unity. The phrase “I, even I" would be better translated from the Hebrew as “I and I". If it were just the Father or the Son speaking, then the correct Hebrew grammar would be just one “I" (ani in Hebrew) But in using “I and I", it is indicating that it is both the Father and the Son that are saying this in unison.
Other bible texts which show similar revelations of a Yahweh who is in heaven, and of a Yahweh who reveals himself on earth are Zechariah 2:11; 12:8; Isaiah 48:15-16.
David knew and had a relationship with both the Father, YHWH God, and the Lord, His Son. - see Psalm 110:1 In the Hebrew, it is .... “YHWH said to My Adon (Lord), sit at My right hand” (two different personalities). This “Lord” of Psalm 110 is the Son, who “has gone into heaven, and is on the right hand of God” (Peter 3:22)
“And we believe and are sure that you are that Messiah, the Son of the living God.” (John 6:69)
{{BookCat}}

THE HOLY SPIRIT
In Hebrew, the original inspired language of the Tanach (Old Testament), the word 'Ruach' cannot be construed as a person. It is a force. It is invisible and like wind, because it can be felt or experienced, but not seen. It is the breath of God which disperses His life-force, His energy and His intentions/mind. It is Yahweh's Spirit which is is omnipresent, but also can be directed in specific ways for specific purposes. It is not His actual Person (which remains incorporeal and outside of the physical dimension) that manifests itself in the world, or which comes to dwell in the hearts and lives of His people.
His spirit can be said to be the emanation of His life-force - i.e. breath
Definition of spirit/ruach: “The basic meaning of ruach is both ‘wind’ or ‘breath,’ but neither is understood as essence; rather it is the power encountered in the breath and the wind, whose whence and whither remains mysterious… 2. ruach as a designation for the wind is necessarily something found in motion with the power to set other things in motion…The divine designation also apparently has an intensifying function in a few passages: ruach elohim (Gen 1:2) and ruach yhwh (Isa 59:19)” (Theological Lexicon of the Old Testament, “Ruach”).
This lexicon also states that ruach (Strongs 7307) implies a power that is within the breath and wind, which is connected to the Name Yahweh. The Holy Spirit is the power emanating from Yahweh, the Heavenly Father. It is Yahweh’s power that puts all things into motion. It is Yahweh’s power through His ruach that breathes life into His creation and makes things live.
The Greek word for Spirit is pneuma (Strongs 4151), which has a similar meaning to the word ruach. “Pneuma; to breathe, blow, primarily denotes the wind. Breath; the spirit which, like the wind, is invisible, immaterial, and powerful” (The Complete Word Study New Testament, “Pneuma”).
The word for “spirit” (rucha, ruach) in Aramaic and Hebrew, is feminine whereas in Greek (pneuma), it is neuter in gender. In some occasions in the Greek text, masculine verb endings and pronouns are used with the neuter gender word “Spirit" when speaking about the holy Spirit, and sometimes it is without the definite article - i.e. just “holy Spirit”.
Although in the Aramaic text rucha is feminine, it also uses masculine grammatical forms with the word. This conveys the male/female attributes of Yahweh carried in His ‘breath’ which of itself is neuter in gender. Being often addressed as “it" and “the", also confirms that it is not another “Person" in a trinity of ‘gods’. The term, “holy Spirit" is a descriptive title and not a name. It is a description given for a specific manifestation of the Father’s Spirit Being. The absence of a personal name indicates that the holy Spirit is not a Person in and of itself, nor is it ever addressed as a third “Person”.
Very significant also that the Holy Spirit is never worshipped. “And every creature which is in heaven, and on the earth, and under the earth, and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, heard I saying, Blessing, and honour, and glory, and power, be unto Him that sits upon the throne, and unto the Lamb for ever and ever.” Revelation 5:13
Neither is there any evidence in the scriptures that the Father or the Son communicate with the Holy Spirit. Paul never addressed the Holy Spirit in any of his greetings in his letters, as he does to the Father and the Son. There is no instance either of anyone praying to or fellowshipping with the Holy Spirit.
“That which we have seen and heard declare we unto you also, that you also may have fellowship with us: yes, and our fellowship is with the Father, and with his Son Jesus Christ.” 1 John 1:3
THE ORIGIN OF THE HOLY SPIRIT
The term in the Hebrew that is translated as 'Holy Spirit' is 'Ha Ruach Ha Kodesh.' There is a specific intention in the terminology “Holy Spirit” as compared to the reference to His Spirit without the definition of “holy”. The Spirit or ‘ruach’ by itself, is the breath of Yahweh which carries His life-force, but not necessarily the Presence of His Person.
When the term “holy Spirit” is used, it denotes the special emanation of the Spirit of God which originates from His throne into our physical world to convey His personal Presence and power. It is dispensed from Him so that He might achieve His purposes in fellowshipping with man, making His will known and performing His mighty acts in miracles, healings and various other interventions in the normal occurrence of events in the world. The holy Spirit is not a separate being, but an emanation, a power that proceeds from (goes out from, or exits) the Father, and is poured out upon His people (Isaiah 32:15, 44:3; Acts 2:17).
“But when the Helper comes, whom I shall send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who proceeds from the Father, He will testify of Me. John 15:26
“But the Helper, the holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in My Name, he will teach you all things, and bring to your remembrance all things that I said to you.” John 14:26
The holy Spirit originates from the Father and is sent by both the Father and the Son. “Therefore being exalted to the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the holy Spirit, He (Yeshua) poured out this which you now see and hear ..” Acts 2:33
The holy Spirit was with the believers before the resurrection, but not in them. He was able to send the holy Spirit after His ascension. which would take His place with and in them. “And I will pray the Father, and He shall give you another Comforter, that he may abide with you for ever; Even the Spirit of truth; whom the world cannot receive, because it sees him not, neither knows him: but you know him; for he dwells with you, and shall be in you. I will not leave you comfortless: I will come to you.” John 14:16-18. Note that the disciples already knew the holy Spirit and that He dwelt with them, but they were to receive the Spirit within them after Yeshua’s resurrection (John 20:20-22) and later, on the day of Pentecost, they were immersed/baptised in the holy Spirit as(Acts 2).
Previously, the holy Spirit had only moved upon men from without. (2 Timothy 3:16; 2 Peter 1:21) The difference was in the Spirit being with them in what they did beforehand, and afterward being in them, empowering them from within. All of this indicating that there are differences of operation by the holy Spirit “differences of ministries, but the same Lord and diversities of activities but the same God” 1 Corinthians 12:5-6
The Holy Spirit takes the Son’s place in ministry on earth when Christ ascends in glory to heaven “If I do not go away the Helper will not come to you, but if I depart, I will send him to you.” John 16:7
“I will not leave you orphans, I will come to you." John 14:18
”But the Helper, the holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in My Name, He will teach you all things ..” John 14:26
“ .... for He will take of mine and declare it unto you. All things that the Father has are mine. Therefore I said that he will take of mine and declare it to you" John16:15
“the Spirit Himself makes intercession for us" Romans 8:26,27
“For it is not you that speak, but the Spirit of your Father which speaks in you.” Matthew 10:20.
“as a many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God.” Romans 8:14
THE HOLY SPIRIT FROM THE FATHER - IN YESHUA - GIVEN TO THE BELIEVERS
Yeshua was conceived of the Holy Spirit. Matthew 1:20
As the Eternal Son, before the foundation of the world, He was brought forth from the Father. As the Son of Man, he was conceived by the holy Spirit which emanated from the Father into this physical realm to impregnate Mirium with His seed. His ‘seed’ was the genetic identity of His Son. He was anointed by the holy Spirit for His ministry at His baptism, and perfected the prototype in Himself for those who would follow Him of a new race, a second “man”.
“This is He (Yeshua) who baptises with the holy Spirit.” John 1:33
Baptism is immersion - i.e. a complete immersion in the Spirit. “But ye are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you. Now if any man have not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.” Romans 8:9.
It is the Spirit of the Father which was in Yeshua that is now in the believers. “And because ye are sons, God has sent forth the Spirit of his Son into your hearts, crying, Abba, Father.” Galatians 4:6.
“the Spirit of God dwells in you” 1 Corinthians 3:16; Romans 8:9
The holy Spirit is the presence of the Father which was also in the Son; (John 14:19-23; John 17:21,23; 1 John 1:3).
“Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit.” 1 Corinthians 12:4.
“For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one body, whether we be Jews or Gentiles, whether we be bond or free; and have been all made to drink into one Spirit.” 1 Corinthians 12:13.
{{BookCat}}

THE NAMES OF THE HOLY SPIRIT
The Spirit of Holiness Romans1:4
The Spirit of Truth John.14:17; 15:26; 16:13
The Comforter/Helper John.14:16,26; 16:7
The Spirit of Promise Ephesians1:13
The Spirit of Life Romans 8:2; Revelation 11:11
The Spirit of Grace and Supplications Zechariah 12:10
The Spirit of Glory 1 Peter 4:14
The Eternal Spirit Hebrews 9;14
The Spirit of Burning Isaiah 4:4 (“our God is a consuming fire”)
THE ROLE OF THE HOLY SPIRIT
It is the Holy Spirit which convicts of sin, empowers, draws men to God, inspires our prayers and intercedes for us (through us), and breaks the yoke of oppression to give spiritual liberty (2 Corinthians 3:17). He also works to produce the fruits of righteousness in those who have received salvation - i.e. "love, joy, peace, long suffering, gentleness, goodness, faith and meekness." Galatians 5:21-22; 2 Corinthians 3:3
The holy Spirit can be: quenched (1Thessalonians 5:19) by neglect, inattentiveness or a lack of devotion
It can also be stirred up (2Timothy 1:6) by praying in the Spirit
And it can be renewed (2Cor. 4:16) by a fresh infilling.
﻿ INTERCHANGE OF TERMINOLOGY - BUT ONE SPIRIT
“There is one body, and one Spirit, even as ye are called in one hope of your calling.” Ephesians 4:4. “For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one body.” I Corinthians 12:13. “There is one body, and one Spirit, even as ye are called in one hope of your calling.” Ephesians 4:4. “For through him we both have access by one Spirit unto the Father.” Ephesians 2:18.
It was the holy Spirit that came upon Yeshua at His baptism, but it is also called the Spirit of God. “And the holy Spirit descended in bodily form like a dove upon Him,” Luke 3:22 “ and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and alighting upon Him." Matthew 3:16 'the Spirit descending upon Him like a dove” Mark 1:10; John 1:32
The holy Spirit is also referred to as the Spirit of God in believers: “if the Spirit of Him who raised up Jesus dwells in you” Romans 8:11
“ the Spirit of God dwell in you.” Romans 8:9; 1 Cor.3:16; Matt.3:16
“the Spirit of the living God” 2 Corinthians 3:3
“no one knows the things of God except the Spirit of God.” 1 Corinthians 2:11
“It is the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you” Matt.10;20; 1 Cor.2:11
“Spirit of YHWH” Luke 4:18
The holy Spirit is identified as the Spirit of the Father (Matt.10:20) ‭which can be sent by either the Father or the Son. (John 14:15, 25-26) The Father was in Yeshua through the Holy Spirit, and so, the fullness of the godhead dwelt in him . The Holy Spirit is most what makes Yeshua, the son of God and the Father one.
It is also called the Spirit of Christ because Yeshua was born of the Holy Spirit. Therefore His own spirit was imparted from the Holy Spirit. “the Spirit of Christ” Romans 8:9 “the Spirit of His Son” Galatians 4:6 “Spirit of Jesus Christ” Philippians1:19
“But ye are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you. Now if any man have not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.” Romans 8:9 “The Spirit itself bears witness with our spirit, that we are the children of God” Romans 8:16 In this context the ”spirit of Christ” is the life of Christ - His nature.
The ‘world‘ - i.e. the unsaved, cannot receive the holy Spirit - John 14:17 An unbeliever has to come to faith in Yeshua first before they can receive the holy Spirit. Note the example of Cornelius in Acts 10. The evidence that they believed in their hearts and were purified by faith was in the fact that the holy Spirit fell upon them - Acts 15:9
VARIOUS OPERATIONS AND GIFTS OF THE SPIRIT
“Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit.
There are differences of ministries, but the same Lord” (1 Corinthians 12:4-5)
There are different measures of the Spirit that a believer can have also. (Philippians 1:19)
Prior to Christ’s coming, the holy Spirit came upon men to inspire and/or anoint them (Judges 3:10: 6:34; 1 Peter 1:11; 2 Timothy 3:16). In John 14:17 Yeshua said how the Holy Spirit was WITH the disciples but that He would be IN them after His resurrection. That was fulfilled in John 20:22 when Yeshua came to them and breathed upon them and they received the initial measure of the Spirit.
He said that He would send the Holy Spirit from the Father and instructed them to wait in prayer until they received that outpouring of the Spirit that came on the day of Pentecost (Acts 1:4-5; 2:4) which was another measure of the Holy Spirit which baptised them into His spiritual Body and empowered them for ministry.
MINISTRY OF THE HOLY SPIRIT
YESHUA PRAYS FOR THE HOLY SPIRIT TO BE SENT AND THE FATHER DOES IT IN HIS NAME
“And I will pray the Father, and He will give you another Helper, even the Spirit of truth, that He may abide with you forever." (John 14:16﻿)
”But the Helper, the holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in My name, ” (John 14:26)
THE HOLY SPIRIT TAKES YESHUA’S PLACE AND ABIDES IN BELIEVERS
“It is to your advantage that I go away, for if I do not go away the Helper will not come to you; but if I depart I will send him to you.” (John 16:7-8)
“And He will give you another Helper,...., that He may abide with you forever." (John 14:16﻿) He continues Yeshua’s ministry of Counsellor, Advocate, Intercessor etc..
“But when the Helper comes, whom I shall send to you from the Father, He will testify of Me.” John 15:26 He brings the reality of Yeshua into the believers life.
FELLOWSHIP WITH THE FATHER & THE SON THROUGH THE SPIRIT
“If anyone loves Me, he will keep My word, and My Father will love him, and we will come to him and make our home with him.” (John 14:23)
“At that day you will know that I am in My Father, and you in Me, and I in you.” (John 14:20)
REVEALS THE MIND & WILL OF GOD
“For what man knows the things of a man, save the spirit of man which is in him? even so the things of God knows no man, but the Spirit of God.” (1 Corinthians 2:11)
“But when the Helper is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, even the Spirit of truth, which proceeds from the Father, he shall bear witness of me:” (John 15:26) (Proceed means to go out of or exit from the father.)
“However, when he the Spirit of truth has come, he will guide you into all truth; for he will not speak on his own authority; but whatever he hears he will speak; ... (progressive revelation of truth) and he will tell you things to come. He will glorify me, ... (prophetic revelations) for he will take of what is mine and declare it to you” (John 16:13-15) ... (prophetic words of edification)
“He will teach you all things, and bring to remembrance all things that I said to you.” (John 14:26 (teaching and quickening of the Word)
CONVICTS OF SIN, RIGHTEOUSNESS AND JUDGMENT
“He will convict the world of sin” ... “because they do not believe in Me” “ ... and of righteousness” ... “because I go to My Father and you see Me no more” “ ... and of judgement“ ... “because the ruler of this world is judged“ (John 16:8-10)”
In making the Presence of Yeshua real, men are convicted of their unbelief and of the unrighteous condition of their soul which will incur the judgement of God if they remain in the kingdom of darkness, under the dominion of the god of this world.
In every respect, the holy Spirit continues the ministry of Yeshua and glorifies Him.
{{BookCat}}

[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Rgrudman!
[[File:Crystal Clear app kedit.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for [[WB:AGF|collaborative]] development of free [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].''' You do not need technical skills to [[Using Wikibooks|contribute]]. You can [[WB:BOLD|easily change most books]]. Please [[WB:CHAT|introduce yourself]], and let us know what [[WB:PROJECTS|interests you]]. If you already contribute at other Wikimedia projects, our [[Wikibooks:Wikibooks for Wikimedians|Wikimedia Orientation]] should quickly get you started.
(Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?)
[[File:Icon apps query.svg|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Getting help'''
* Read the [[Using Wikibooks]] book for a friendly introduction to the project, or our [[Help:Contents|help pages]] for more information. * You can get friendly help from the community in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]] or our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * Upload freely licensed files to [[commons:Wikimedia Commons|Wikimedia Commons]]. You may [[WB:RFP|request permission]] to upload [[w:fair use|fair use]] files locally. Please include author and source {{tl|information}} and a {{nowrap|{{tl|non-free use rationale}}}} for [[WB:FU|non-free]] files.
[[File:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* You can [[WB:REVERT|restore]] a previously saved version. * Pages should follow the [[WB:NP|'''Book Title/Chapter Title''']] naming convention. * Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (is available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To request a page be deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason''}} to the top of the page. * Was a page you made deleted? Please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:RFD|RFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:RFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
[[File:Transmission icon.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please fill in [[WB:ES|the edit summary]] and [[WB:PREVIEW|preview]] your edits before saving. * Sign your name on [[WB:TALK|discussion pages]] by typing ~~~~ * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
--[[User:Xania|ЗAНИA]] [[Image:Flag_of_Italy.svg|15px]][[User talk:Xania|talk]] 11:12, 25 August 2011 (UTC) ==Unexplained deletion of material from [[European History]]== You recently deleted a substantial quantity of material from the [[European History]] book without explaining why you did this. As there seemed no obvious problems with the material you deleted, I intend to restore most of it. [[User:Recent Runes|Recent Runes]] ([[User talk:Recent Runes|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Recent Runes|contribs]]) 11:04, 4 September 2011 (UTC)

WHAT IS LIFE?
Y'shua said, "I am come that they might have life and have it more abundantly" John 10:10 What is this life which Y'shua came to give us? How do we increase the measure of it?
John 5:24 EVERLASTING life implies life that lasts forever, unceasing, forever. John 10:28 ETERNAL life is life of an eternal quality, beyond the realm of time, and the laws of natural existence, that is, completely out of the natural sphere.
We have a promise of everlasting life, life that will extend beyond this life, but the nature of this life is also eternal, of a different quality and nature than our earthly life in this physical body.
How can we have life and have a more abundant measure of it? (Ephesians 2:5-8; John 5:39)
"But whoever takes a drink of the water (life) that I will give him shall never, no never be thirsty any more. But the water that I will give him shall become a spring of water welling up (flowing bubbling) continually within him unto (into, or for) eternal life." John 4:14 (Amplified version) Inner resources of life, an inner spring of refreshment. What is it's source?
"This is life eternal, that they might know thee the only true God, and Y'shua the Messiah, whom You have sent." John 17:3 Knowing the Father and the Son - revelation knowledge Matt.16:17,18; 2 Corinthians 3:18
This life is through KNOWING Him! i.e. Relationship
There are degrees of relationship
The degree of relationship determines the degree of life. Desire closer relationship? - there is a need to draw closer, unveil and surrender self. It depends on closeness and intimacy.
Greatest depth of relationship in this life is in marriage. Becoming one flesh!!! In this there is complete identification - complete exposure - Complete giving of self
A surrender of personal identity is needed to contract a marriage, to take on another name, to become one, having everything yielded and surrendered to the other.
"And you shalt love Yahweh your God with all your heart, and with all thy soul, and with all your mind, and with all thy strength: this is the first commandment. And the second is like, namely this, You shalt love your neighbour as yourself." Mark 12:30,31
Heart, soul, mind and strength - Emotions, personality, thoughts and all one's energies.
Primarily Yahweh God, secondly others!
The religion of 'good works' has others first Relationship with God is of primary importance - not doing good to, and loving others. Placing Yahweh and His principles first in every area of our life renders firstly allegiance to Him, all others are in second place - neighbours and self. He will be our first love and commitment in life. No conflict of loyalties Luke 14:26; Colossians 3:17
1. NATURE OF OUR RELATIONSHIP WITH THE SON.
"I have espoused you to one husband ..." (2 Corinthians 11:2) betrothed, set you aside for Him 'betrothed'(R.S.V) - lit. 'fitted together' an 'engagement' period, a time period of preparedness for marriage A development of relationship - "I will betroth you to me in faithfulness: and you shall know Yahweh." Hosea 2:19,20
A Bride-to-be makes herself attractive and desires to be beautiful in the eyes of her lover, learns to adapt to and please Him in all things. It is separation from others, to Him
It takes preparation to be a Bride! Rev.19:7,8 - the process Ephesians 3:18, 19
We need to be filled with the knowledge of His love, consumed with passion for Him - we love Him because He first loved us (1 John.4:19) There is a transforming power in love.
Cultivating relationship requires time, attentiveness, desire, contemplation, patience and understanding, and mostly self-sacrifice.
He purposes to have a Bride without spot or wrinkle or any such thing Ephesians 5:27 - holy, without blemish. Nothing that mars her image in His sight - flawless and pure
The wooing and initiation of the preparation is done by Him, "I have loved you with an everlasting love; therefore with lovingkindness have I drawn you." Jeremiah 31:3
"And I will betroth thee unto me forever; yea, I will betroth thee unto me in righteousness, and in judgement, and in lovingkindness, and in mercies. Hosea 2:18 & Song of Sol.1:2-4
RENEWAL COMPLETE - She is "prepared as a bride adorned for her husband;" Rev.21:2
"Come, I will show you the Bride, the Lamb's wife. ..... the holy city Jerusalem coming down out of heaven from God, " (Rev.21:9, 10) verse 11-15 is a description of the spiritual beauty of the 'city', the Lamb's wife.
"I will greatly rejoice in the Lord, my soul shall be joyful in my God; for He hath clothed me with the garments of salvation, he hath covered me with the robes of righteousness, as a bridegroom decks himself with ornaments (headdress) and as a bride adorns herself with her jewels " Isaiah 61:10
"and as the Bridegroom rejoices over the Bride, so shall thy God rejoice over thee." (Isaiah 62:5) "the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, " Jeremiah 33:11 - Fulfilment and Fellowship
He has desired us with a 'passionate' love which motivated Him to lay down His life for us, to obtain us as His bride Ephesians 5:25-27; Heb.12:2;
Revelation 22:17 "the Spirit and the Bride say 'Come'" - here is evidence the union is complete.
Head is joined to the Body, the Bridegroom joined to the Bride - her life is now His. Complete unity of thought and purpose, identification with the Son in the image of the Father is complete.
FAITHFULNESS is required in our devotion to the Lord. I.E. Moral purity
"I am jealous for you with the deep concern of God Himself - jealous that your love should be for Messiah alone, just as a pure maiden gives her love to one man only, the one who will be her husband." 2 Corinthians 11:2 (Living letters by Kenneth Taylor)
Unfaithfulness is adultery!
"Can a maid forget her ornaments, or a bride her attire? yet my people have forgotten me days without number." Jeremiah 2:32 Spiritual coldness, unfaithfulness? Other preoccupations, cares of this life, things/people that rule our heart and claim our attention. Distractions from a single-minded fervent love toward Him. Colossians 3:2
2. NATURE OF OUR RELATIONSHIP WITH THE FATHER
A Son is submitted to and dependant upon the Father for life, provision, instruction and correction. Y'shua was the example of the perfect Son, He always perceived the Father through a life of complete yieldedness. He was a perfect representation of the Father's Person - "He that sees me, sees Him that sent me" John 12:45 'see' is THEOREO - 'to view' "He that hath seen me, hath seen the Father" John 14:7-9 'see' here is 'discerned ORAO
Use of two words for 'see' in Greek 1. THEOREO to view, physically sight 2. ORAO to discern, or take heed, spiritual or mental comprehension
It is the result of relationship - "what he hath seen (discerned) and heard, that he testifies" John 3:32
Unbroken looking, listening attitude, waiting upon Him "I speak that which I have seen (discerned) with my Father" John 8:38
In relationship with the Father, He discerned His intentions "Ye have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his shape; and ye have not his word abiding in you:" John 5:37,38
His Word found no place in their heart - no relationship
The Word needs to ABIDE in us. John 15:4-8
If ye abide in me, and my words abide (are living) in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you." John 15:7 The Word has to be living in us, not just head knowledge. Has to be that which He has communicated to receptive hearts, a spiritual impartation. 2 Corinthians 3:3; John 6:63
REVELATION KNOWLEDGE - necessary for spiritual relationship
"Not that any man hath seen (discerned) the Father save He which is of God. He hath seen the Father." " He that believes on me hath everlasting life" John 6:46,47
Having His life is dependant upon DISCERNING Him spiritually. The Church is built upon the REVELATION of the Son of God. It is the foundation stone, the essential element of spiritual birthing. Matt.16:16-18; John 3:3 i.e. relationship
THE PRESENCE OF GOD
"I do nothing of myself; but as the Father hath taught me, I speak these things. And he that sent me is with me." John 8:28b,29 Acting on the instruction of the Father - result was the constant presence of God
".. a little while and ye shall not see (view) me" John 16:16,17,19 .. again a little while, and ye shall see (discern) me" ( i.e. spiritually) John 16:16,17
"Ye shall see (discern) Me, because I live (in resurrection life - eternal life) ye shall live also" (in the same quality of life)
"At that day, ye shall know that I am in my Father, and ye in me, and I in you." John 16:20 The presence of the Lord is within through the Holy Spirit John 14:17
OBEDIENCE AS A SON IS THE KEY - "He that hath my commandments and keeps them; he it is that loves me: and he that loves me shall be loved of my Father, and I will love Him, and will manifest myself to Him." John 14:21 Manifestation of the presence of Y'shua in return for obedience
"If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love." John 15:10 Maintenance of love relationship through obedience
"If a man love me, he will keep my words: and my Father will love him, and we will come unto him, and make our abode with him." John 14:23b
FATHER & SON will dwell with those who obey - they receive an impartation of their life
FUNCTION OF THE SPIRIT
He, who is the manifestation of His presence, will
"teach you all things" Be a Guide and Instructor
"Bring to you remembrance whatsoever I have said unto you" Quicken the Word
The Holy Spirit as the indwelling presence of God is the means of communication with the Father and the Son. He is the 'other Comforter/Counsellor' who will abide with us forever. John 14:16
He takes that which is of the Father and the Son and reveals it unto us. John 16:13-15
He communicates and applies to our life the will of the Father by either illumination of the Word, or direct revelation. If we yield and obey, we will have the same experience that Y'shua had of listening to and receiving that which is from the Father.
"Whatsoever He shall hear, that shall He speak:" John 16:13
"He shall receive of mine, and shall shew it unto you." John 16:14
"For the Spirit searches all things, yea, the deep things of God." "We have received the Spirit of God, so that we might know the things that are freely given to us of God." 1 Corinthians 2:10,12
His abundant grace has freely given to us all things (2 Peter 1:3; Ephesians 1:18,19) and the knowledge of the things of Yahweh is interpreted to us through the Holy Spirit.
"Do you believe that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? the words that I speak unto you I speak not of myself: but the Father that dwells in me, he does the works. Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father in me." John 14;10,11a
The result of His walk – was complete identification as a mature Son of the Father
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: moved [[Hebrew Roots/Principles]] to [[Hebrew Roots/Knowing God/Principles]]: this one's correct
revision.text: #REDIRECT [[Hebrew Roots/Knowing God/Principles]]

WALK IN THE SPIRIT
We need to walk according to the new man, Messiah Y'shua. Ephesians 4:23-29,31-32 It has to be an ongoing relationship with the Father and Son through the Holy Spirit.
ONGOING RELATIONSHIP
The seal of the Spirit is the initial deposit of the Spirit which is imparted into our lives, received at salvation, which He purchased for us by His blood (Ephesians 1:13 the 'earnest' of our inheritance; 2 Corinthians 1:22)
This measure of the Spirit needs to be added to, to complete the measure of Messiah in our life. This was the redemption of the 'possession' which was purchased at Calvary (Ephesians 1:14), from which we must grow up into Him in all things (Ephesians 4:15)
The Holy Spirit needs to increase in our lives until He completely fills us and our salvation has been completely worked out by us coming into all He purchased for us. Ephesians 4:13
"Work out your own salvation with fear and trembling; for it is God which works in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure." Philippians 2:12b, 13
"Being confident of this very thing, that he which has begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Y'shua the Messiah." Philippians 1:6
Yahweh works in and through His Spirit that dwells within us to complete the work of salvation in our life, which He will do if unhindered – that is, if we yield to Him.
Our full inheritance is God's intention & purpose, the choice ours, whether it will be a 30, 60 or 100-fold increase?
BREAK-DOWN OF RELATIONSHIP
"Grieve not the Holy Spirit whereby you are sealed unto the day of redemption" Break down in our relationship with Yahweh, causes Him grief Ephesians 1:13,14 "Quench not the Spirit" (1 Thessalonians 5:19) the flame of the Spirit in our hearts- the zeal and love.
These two aspects are related to POWER & RELATIONSHIP (His Power and Presence in our lives)
The Holy Spirit is pictured as a dove, and is tender, easily wounded, without gall, therefore He cannot partake of anything 'bitter'. He withdraws from all that is flesh (Ex.14:23-25) Allow Him reign, or insult Him and He will be quenched and grieved
THEREFORE -
SILENCE THE WORKINGS OF THE NATURAL MIND so as to be receptive to the spiritual mind, i.e.. the mind of Messiah. When one is operating the other cannot.
YIELD THE WILL unto God, so that all our faculties are under the influence of the Holy Spirit. The only way He can guide is when there is submission.
OBEDIENCE IS NECESSARY to the movings/promptings of the Spirit, for He is our means of perception of that which the Father is doing. We lose contact if don't keep in step.
OTHERWISE -- NO PROGRESS/GROWTH
"But of him are ye in Messiah Y'shua, who of God is made unto us wisdom, "He is the source of your life in Y'shua the Messiah, whom God made our wisdom, " 1 Corinthians 1:31 Amplified Version)
"For who hath known the mind of the Lord, that he may instruct him? But WE HAVE THE MIND OF MESSIAH" 1 Corinthians 2:14,16
The deposit of The Holy Spirit within is the source of all wisdom and knowledge. We have the mind of Messiah through His indwelling presence. John 16:14,15; also James 1:5
"But the natural man does not receive the things of the Spirit of God for they are foolishness unto him: neither can he know them for they are spiritually discerned.
"For they that are after the flesh do mind the things of the flesh; but they that are after the Spirit, the things of the Spirit. "For to be carnally (naturally) minded is death; but to be spiritually minded is life and peace. (in harmony/unity with the source of life)
"Because the carnal mind (the mind of the fleshly nature) is enmity against God: for it is not subject to the law of God, neither indeed can be. So then they that are in the flesh CANNOT please God." Romans 8:5-8
There are two sources of life, the natural and the spiritual, the outlook of each are opposed one to the other, and belong to different 'worlds'. We cannot perceive spiritual things while in the fleshly realm. We need to come out of the flesh to enter the Spirit. To 'see' and understand spiritual realities, requires our spiritual perceptions to be exercised. The natural life operates under different laws/principles to the spiritual life – and is not, and cannot be subject to them.
But actually, “you are not in the flesh IF the Spirit of God is dwelling in you”. (Romans 8:9a) , that is, if you are abiding in Him, in the Word and not in sin - walking according to your own mind, i.e. your own reasonings.
"Trust in the Lord with all your heart; (for wisdom, revelation etc.) and lean not unto your own understanding. In all thy ways acknowledge Him; and He shall direct your paths. Be not wise in your own eyes: fear the Lord and depart from evil." (the root of evil is self-determination - i.e. your own way) Proverbs 3:5-7
"The god of this world has blinded the minds of them that believe not " - lest the illumination of Messiah should penetrate their hearts 2 Corinthians 4:4 Unbelief causes spiritual blindness Hebrews 3:19; 4:1,2 Unbelief = Disobedience
Unbelief is not receiving the Word and allowing it to penetrate and persuade the heart to bring about obedience. Unbelief involves reasonings 'hath God said?', 'does this apply to me?'. Reasonings justify excuses against obeying. The Word of God as a result, is made of no effect - Mk.7:6-13
DISCERN HIM BY FAITH.
Knowing Him requires faith – it is not a natural relationship. We cannot know Him through our fleshly perceptions. 2 Corinthians 5:16 It is not revealed by 'flesh and blood' perceptions - sight, hearing etc. - Matt.16:17b
Faith is the faculty which opens up the spiritual realm. (definition Heb.11:1)
"While we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen: for the things which are seen are temporal, but the things which are not seen are eternal." 2 Corinthians 4:18
We change according to what we behold 2 Corinthians 3:18 - we reflect the image of what occupies our minds. We can choose what occupies our attention!
"If you then were raised with Messiah, seek those things which are above, where Messiah sits on the right hand of God. (reality of His victory over sin & death)
Set your affection (thinking) on things above, not on things on the earth." Colossians 3:1-3
Natural thinking hinders our perceptions and receptivity to the Spirit. We need to keep our minds on the spiritual. We need to live in spiritual realities, in resurrection life – in victory over the flesh.
"For whatsoever is born of God overcomes the world: and this is the victory that overcomes the world, even our faith" 1 John 5:4
"Beware lest any man spoil you through philosophy which is vain deceit, after the traditions of men, after the elements of the world and not after Messiah." Colossians 2:8
Philosophy is man's reasonings, human concepts and conclusions regarding truth. Human reasonings, human ordinances and the elemental spirits of this world (the spiritual influences of this world) 'spoil' us (lit. 'strip'), - they rob us spiritually.
We cannot know Him or His ways by reasoning. - "My thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways:" Isaiah 55:8,9 "Be renewed in the spirit of your mind and put on the new man which is renewed in knowledge of the image of him that created him." Ephesians 4:23, also Colossians 3:10
"Casting down imaginations (reasonings, the workings of the natural mind) and every high thing that exalts itself against the knowledge of God,(every stronghold) and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Messiah; ('take every thought captive to obey Messiah' Amp.) And having in readiness to revenge all disobedience when your obedience is fulfilled." (being ready to punish every disobedience, when your obedience is complete” (Amplified Version) 2 Corinthians 10:5,6
WAITING UPON GOD
The word WAIT means 'to bind together by twisting', 'to wait in expectation' – i.e. reaching out to Him. It is an attitude of HEART that is transfixed upon Him. Not waiting in the sense of time but in the sense of being wholly centred in Him. See Psalm 123:1-2
By waiting upon Him you become bound together as one with Him, your life entwined in His. Complete identification! You exchange your life for His!
"They that wait upon the Lord shall renew (change) their strength: " Isaiah 40:31 (from natural to spiritual)
"Keep silence before me, O islands; and let the people renew (change) their strength " Isaiah 41:1a
When the natural mind is put out of operation – a renewing, an exchange of life takes place. (His life is exchanged for ours)
Our perceptions are opened to receive revelation by the Spirit. There is an unveiling of Himself and His spiritual treasures to those who wholly stay themselves upon Him -
".. men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither has the eye seen, O God, beside thee, what He has prepared for him that waits for Him " Isaiah 64:4
Waiting upon Him is interpreted as loving Him - becoming at-one-with Him, joined in union with Him, Paul translates this verse from the Hebrew as "the things which God has prepared for those that love him " 1 Corinthians 2:9 (Quote from Isaiah 64:4)
WAITING --> LOVE
Waiting upon Him will result in relationship :::: in a revelation of His Person
To know Him is to love Him!
He the Lover, reveals Himself to the one whose desire is toward Him Depth of relationship is in proportion to the intensity of desire to seek after knowing Him, that is, in being one with Him. See Psalm 42:1
"Blessed are the pure in heart., for they shall see God" (pure – single in purpose) Matthew 5:8 "Blessed are they that hunger and thirst after righteousness, for they shall be filled." Matthew 5:6
"The eyes of your understanding being enlightened; that ye may know what is the hope of his calling, and what is the riches of the glory of his inheritance IN the saints." Ephesians 1:18
Knowing our calling, what He has called us to, and our inheritance, is dependant upon enlightenment. (spiritual revelation - waiting upon Him) It is not given to the casual seeker. Matthew 13:45,46
As co-heirs with Him, and being in Him, His inheritance is ours. He is the firstborn among many brethren (Rom.8:29; Heb.12:23) - all things are to be subjected to Him (Heb.2:5,8) and we inherit with Him as His brethren!
"Of his own will begot he us with the word of truth, that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures." James 1:18,19
"Wherefore gird up the loins of your mind, be sober, and hope to the end for the grace that is to be brought unto you at the revelation of Y'shua Messiah." 1 Peter:1:13
The full, ultimate complete revelation of Messiah in us!
{{BookCat}}

FAITHFULNESS
"For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Messiah." 2 Corinthians 11:2
Paul is constrained by the love of Messiah - motivated by the jealousy of the Lord To present the 'Church' as a chaste virgin - one who is faithful to the Lord
The word 'to espouse' means to fit together as a piece of joinery work (carpentry) i.e. to be perfectly fitted or joined together, made to complement, to harmonise doesn't allow for an independent spirit. (abiding in Him John Ch.15)
The Lord is jealous for His Bride-to-be and regards her as His rightful possession (purchased with His blood 1 Corinthians 6:19,20). Our salvation is a contract, a covenant, made at conversion and yet to be fulfilled, a betrothal contract of a future marriage (Ephesians 1:11-14; Revelation 21:2).
We received a measure, a deposit of the Spirit when we believed, we fulfil our obligation to the contract by going on in our relationship with the Lord, He fulfils His by proportionately increasing the measure of the Spirit in our lives. (Revelation 19:7,8 - she made herself ready, - He clothes her in His righteousness)
Breach or violation of the contract merits lawful action from Him .....i.e. judgement.
"I was jealous for Zion with great jealousy, and I was jealous for her with great fury." Zechariah 8:2 His anger was stirred against Israel's unfaithfulness.
"Know ye not that your bodies are the members of Messiah? shall I then take the members of Messiah, and make them the members of an harlot? God forbid. What? know ye not that he which is joined to an harlot is one body? for two, saith he, shall be one flesh."
"What? know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit which is in you, which ye have of God, and ye are not your own? For ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are God's." 1 Corinthians 6:15,16; 19,20 He has the right of ownership. We have the choice of honouring the union which we have with Him or being a spiritual harlot. We are bonded by fellowship - that which we partake of.
PARTAKERS OF MESSIAH - OR IDOLS? 1 Corinthians 10:14-22
"For we being many are one bread, and one body: for we are all partakers of that one bread" (v.17) we are all members of the Body of Messiah, Who is the Bread of Life. we are all partakers of Messiah through fellowship - we partake of His life.
"Behold Israel after the flesh: are not they which eat of the sacrifices partakers of the altar?" (v.18) partaking of what has been offered is partaking of the altar i.e. participating in what the altar represents.
"What do I say then? that the idol is any thing, or that which is offered in sacrifice to idols is anything? But I say, that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to devils, and not to God: and I would not that you should have fellowship with devils. Ye cannot drink the cup of the Lord, and the cup of devils: ye cannot be partakers of the Lord's table and the table of devils. Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? ....." (vs.19-22a)
The idol is nothing (the earth and all therein is the Lord's), it is the involvement. Offering of sacrifices are a token of submission to, and high estimation of the object. A bowing down of heart and a bonding to that thing. Love & worship of it.
("With their idols they have committed adultery" Ezekiel 23:27) Idolatry is spiritual adultery - love of people/things or the lifestyle of this world
"Wherefore, my dearly beloved, flee from idolatry." (v.14)
JUDGEMENT UPON IDOLATRY
"Take heed to yourselves. lest ye forget the covenant of the Lord your God, which he made with you, and make you a graven image, or the likeness of anything, which the Lord God hath forbidden you. (Lev.26:1) For the Lord thy God is a consuming fire, even a jealous God."
"I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that ye shall utterly perish from off the land whereunto you go to possess it; ye shall not prolong your days upon it, but shall utterly be destroyed." Deuteronomy 4:23,23,26 (Death, destruction & loss)
"Turn ye not to idols, nor make to yourselves molten gods: I am Yahweh your God." Lev.19:4 Idols are anything which we worship or love, that our heart is set upon.
BUT
"They provoked him to jealousy with strange gods, with abominations provoked they him to anger."
"Of the Rock that begot you you art unmindful, and hast forgotten the God that formed you. And when Yahweh saw it, he abhorred them, because of the provoking of his sons and daughters. And he said, I WILL HIDE MY FACE FROM THEM, I will see what their end shall be; for they are a very froward generation, children in whom is no faith. They have moved me to jealousy with that which is not God; they have provoked me to anger with their vanities:" (specific judgement stated upon Israel in v.26)
"O that they were wise, that they understood this, that they would consider their latter end! How one should chase a thousand, and two put ten thousand to flight, except their Rock HAD SOLD THEM, and Yahweh HAD SHUT THEM UP." Deuteronomy 32:16,18-21,29
ABHORRED THEM - No blessing
HID HIS FACE - withdrawal of His presence from them. Hosea 5:15
SOLD THEM - reversal of the original contract, 'sold' to the enemy.
SHUT THEM UP - no liberty, slavery and bondage to the flesh.
"Therefore thou hast forsaken the house of Jacob, because (they were filled with unclean worship and reasonings of their own mind) and they please themselves in the children of strangers," "Their land also is full of idols; they worship the work of their own hands, that which their own fingers have made:" Isaiah 2:6,8
"They served their idols which were a snare unto them." ( v.36) Psalm 106:36-43 R.V. "They became unclean by their acts, and played the harlot in their doings." v.39
HE BECAME ANGRY AND ABHORRED THEM v.40
GAVE THEM OVER TO THE UNSAVED TO BE RULED BY THOSE THAT HATED THEM v.41
OPPRESSED BY THE ENEMY AND DOMINATED BY HIS POWER v.42
"Many times he delivered them, but they were rebellious in their purposes, and they were brought low through their iniquity." v.43
Also Ezekiel 23:30 - :I will do these things unto thee, because thou hast gone a-whoring after the heathen, and because thou art polluted with their idols." " ... scorn (v.32), drunkenness and sorrow, astonishment and desolation (v.33) "Because thou hast forgotten me, and cast me behind thy back, therefore bear thou also thy lewdness and thy whoredoms." (v.35)
Blinded by their own reasonings they walked in self-will and stubbornness.
AND
"Rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft, and stubbornness is as iniquity and idolatry." (Idolatry hardens the heart to God, become stubborn & self-willed) 1 Samuel 15:23
Israel then is our example, the pattern of spiritual principles 1 Corinthians 10 What Yahweh did with Israel in the natural. He does in the new covenant in the spiritual.
" ... defiled with your idols" (Ezekiel 22:4) "If any man defile the temple of God, him shall God destroy" (1 Corinthians 3:17) (destroy means defile, make unclean) i.e.given over to spiritual uncleanness. Spiritual destruction will come on those who defile or corrupt His spiritual House.
"And such were some of you. (idolators etc.) But you were washed, you were sanctified, you were justified in the name of the Lord Y'shua Messiah and in the Spirit of our God." We annul the covenant by returning to old sins - forgotten you were cleansed (1 Corinthians 6:11)
"Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man sows, that shall he also reap. He that sows to the flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption; ...." Galatians 6:7,8a
The Book of Ezekiel is prophetic of N.T. Age and Millenium " ...and you shall bear the sins of your idols." Ezekiel 23:49 "which went astray from me after their idols; they shall even bear their iniquity." Ezekiel 44:10
You come under the power of what you worship, it is your god, and you are dominated by it.
NEW COVENANT PRINCIPLES
The same principle of judgement is in the new Covenant! "Y'shua the Messiah, the same yesterday, today, and forever." (Hebrews 13:8) "flee from idolatry" (1 Corinthians 10:14)
" ....... covetousness (desire for things), which is idolatry" Colossians 3:5
"idolatry" Gal.6:20 (listed as an work of the flesh)
"Let the time that is past suffice for doing what the Gentiles like to do, living in ...................... lawless idolatry." 1 Peter 4:3
"Neither be ye idolators, as some of them were ....." (the Israelites) 1 Corinthians 10:7
BECAUSE
it breaks fellowship with Yahweh Ezekiel 6:9
"And we know that the Son of God is come, and has given us an understanding, that we may KNOW him that is true, even in His Son Y'shua the Messiah. This is the true God and eternal life. Little children, keep yourselves from idols. " 1 John 5:20,21
Keeping yourselves from idols is the key to knowing Him and having His life.
"For this is the love of God, that we keep his commandments: and his commandments are not grievous (i.e. hard)" 1 John 5:3 "Do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived; neither the immoral, nor idolators ......" 1 Corinthians 6:9,10
NO INHERITANCE - You disqualify your spiritual inheritance (Romans 14:17), by being severed from the Life-source. Joined in harlotry to the object of your affections. (Colossians 3:1-3)
"But now I have written unto you not to keep company, if any man that is called a brother be a fornicator, or covetous, or an idolator, ............." 1 Corinthians 5:11
"Therefore put away from among yourselves that wicked person." 1 Corinthians 5:13b
BROKEN FELLOWSHIP - Dis-fellowshiping is the enactment of the broken fellowship from the Lord. They are " .... estranged from me through their idols" (Ezekiel 14:5)
Judgement by the Body necessary to separate the leaven from within itself 1 Corinthians 5:6,7
ULTIMATE JUDGEMENT
" ...idolators, and all liars, shall have their part in the lake which burns with fire and brimstone: which is the second death." Rev.21:8
" For without (the city of God) are ........... idolators ....." Rev.22:15
This is exclusion from the presence of Yahweh, the judgement of eternal death.
{{BookCat}}

==Welcome!== [[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome to Wikibooks]]! You do not need to [[WB:LOGIN|log in]] to read or edit books at Wikibooks, but creating an account is quick, free and non-intrusive, requires no personal information, and gives you many benefits, including: * A username of your choice for directly attributing [[Special:Contributions/{{PAGENAME}}|your contributions]]. * A personal user page, a [[WB:TALK|talk page]], and a [[Help:Tracking changes#Watching pages|watchlist]] to monitor pages that interest you. * The ability to [[WB:MOVE|rename]] pages and to [[WB:PREFS|customize]] some aspects of the Wikibooks interface. * People will recognize you as a member of the Wikibooks community, and you will be eligible to [[WB:REVIEW|review]] pages. * Your IP address will be hidden from most users, which may give you a greater sense of security and privacy.
We hope that you choose to join our community as a Wikibookian and [[Special:Userlogin|create an account]].
Feel free to ask any questions on my talk page or in the [[Wikibooks:Reading room|Reading room]]. Be sure to sign your talk page comments with four tildes (<nowiki>~~~~</nowiki>).
--[[User:Xania|ЗAНИA]] [[Image:Flag_of_Italy.svg|15px]][[User talk:Xania|<sup>talk</sup>]] 11:49, 25 August 2011 (UTC)

[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Desacelerator!
[[File:Crystal Clear app kedit.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for [[WB:AGF|collaborative]] development of free [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].''' You do not need technical skills to [[Using Wikibooks|contribute]]. You can [[WB:BOLD|easily change most books]]. Please [[WB:CHAT|introduce yourself]], and let us know what [[WB:PROJECTS|interests you]]. If you already contribute at other Wikimedia projects, our [[Wikibooks:Wikibooks for Wikimedians|Wikimedia Orientation]] should quickly get you started.
(Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?)
[[File:Icon apps query.svg|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Getting help'''
* Read the [[Using Wikibooks]] book for a friendly introduction to the project, or our [[Help:Contents|help pages]] for more information. * You can get friendly help from the community in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]] or our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * Upload freely licensed files to [[commons:Wikimedia Commons|Wikimedia Commons]]. You may [[WB:RFP|request permission]] to upload [[w:fair use|fair use]] files locally. Please include author and source {{tl|information}} and a {{nowrap|{{tl|non-free use rationale}}}} for [[WB:FU|non-free]] files.
[[File:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* You can [[WB:REVERT|restore]] a previously saved version. * Pages should follow the [[WB:NP|'''Book Title/Chapter Title''']] naming convention. * Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (is available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To request a page be deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason''}} to the top of the page. * Was a page you made deleted? Please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:RFD|RFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:RFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
[[File:Transmission icon.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please fill in [[WB:ES|the edit summary]] and [[WB:PREVIEW|preview]] your edits before saving. * Sign your name on [[WB:TALK|discussion pages]] by typing ~~~~ * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
--[[User:Xania|ЗAНИA]] [[Image:Flag_of_Italy.svg|15px]][[User talk:Xania|talk]] 11:49, 25 August 2011 (UTC)

revision.comment: [[WB:REVERT|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/190.10.201.130|190.10.201.130]] ([[User talk:190.10.201.130|talk]]) to last version by 98.67.61.184
revision.text:
{{TOC right}} We are all familiar with matter. The definition of matter is anything that has mass and volume (takes up space). For most common objects that we deal with every day, it is fairly simple to demonstrate that they have mass and take up space. You might be able to imagine, however, the difficulty for people several hundred years ago to demonstrate that air has mass and volume. Air (and all other gases) are invisible to the eye, have very small masses compared to equal amounts of solids and liquids, and are quite easy to compress (change volume). Without sensitive equipment, it would have been difficult to convince people that gases are matter. Today, we can measure the mass of a small balloon when it is deflated and then blow it up, tie it off, and measure its mass again to detect the additional mass due to the air inside. The mass of air, under room conditions, that occupies a one quart jar is approximately 0.0002 pounds. This small amount of mass would have been difficult to measure in times before balances were designed to accurately measure very small masses. Later, scientists were able to compress gases into such a small volume that the gases turned into liquids, which made it clear that gases are matter. On the other hand, when you add heat to an object, the temperature of the object increases, but even the most sensitive balance cannot detect any difference in mass between an object when cold and when hot. Heat does not qualify as matter. ==Lesson Objectives== * Define matter and explain how it is composed of building blocks known as "atoms". * Distinguish between mass and weight. ==The Material in the Universe== Knowing that planets, solar systems, and even galaxies are made out of matter doesn't bring us any closer to understanding what matter is. Up until the early 1800s, people didn't really understand matter at all. They knew that there were "things" in the world that they could pick up and use, and that some of these "things" could be turned into other "things". For example, someone who found a piece of copper could shape it into a necklace or melt it together with zinc to make brass. What people didn't know, though, was how all of these "things" were related. If they had, the alchemists probably wouldn’t have wasted so much time trying to convert common metals into gold. You’ll understand why by the time you're finished with this section. Even though the universe consists of "things" as wildly different as ants and galaxies, the matter that makes up all of these "things" is composed of a very limited number of building blocks (Figure 1.18). {{multiple image | align = center | footer = '''Figure 1.18''': Everything from an ant to an entire galaxy is composed of matter. | image1 = Ant Receives Honeydew from Aphid.jpg | width1 = 250 | alt1 = Ant receiving honeydew from aphid | image2 = Messier 81 HST.jpg | width2 = 249 | alt2 = A spiral galaxy }} These building blocks are known as atoms, and so far, scientists have discovered or created a grand total of 118 different types of atoms. Scientists have given a name to each different type of atom. A substance that is composed of only one type of atom is called an element. Each element, therefore, has its own name; it also has its own symbol. The "periodic table" is a way of summarizing all of the different atoms that scientists have discovered (Figure 1.19). Each square in the periodic table contains the symbol (a capital letter or a capital letter followed by a lower case letter) for one of the elements. [[File:Tableau periodique base.svg|600px|center|thumb|'''Figure 1.19''': The Periodic Table]] At this point, what should amaze you is that all forms of matter in our universe are made with only 118 different building blocks. In some ways, it's sort of like cooking a gourmet, five-course meal using only three ingredients! How is it possible? To answer that question, you have to understand the ways in which different elements are put together to form matter. The most important method that nature uses to organize atoms into matter is the formation of molecules. Molecules are groups of two or more atoms that have been bonded together. There are millions of different ways to bond atoms together, which means that there are millions of different possible molecules. Each of these molecules has its own set of chemical properties, and it's these properties with which chemists are most concerned. You will learn a lot more about atoms and molecules, including how they were discovered, in a later part of the textbook. Figure 1.20, however, gives you a preview of some of the common molecules that you might come in contact with on a daily basis. [[File:Common molecules and atoms.png|500px|center|thumb|'''Figure 1.20''': Some common molecules and the atoms that they are made from.]] Now back to the question of why alchemists had trouble making gold out of other common metals. Most naturally occurring metals, including gold, iron, copper, and silver are ''elements''. Look carefully at the Periodic Table in Figure 1.19. Do you see the symbol Au? Au is the symbol for gold. Gold is one of the 118 different types of atoms – it's one of nature's building blocks. Take another look at the Periodic Table. Do you see the symbol Fe? Fe is the symbol for iron. Again, that means that iron is an element, or a type of atom. In fact, copper (Cu), tin (Sn), and silver (Ag) are all elements. In other words, alchemists were trying to convert one type of element, or building block, into another type of element, and that just can't be done by chemical means. Chemical reactions can turn elements into molecules, molecules into other molecules, and molecules back into elements. Chemical reactions cannot, however, turn one type of element into another type of element. The only way to do that is through what are known as ''nuclear'' reactions, and nuclear reactions require advanced technical equipment that wasn't around in the days of the alchemists. It's like building a house. You can make a house by cementing together bricks, stones, and wood, just like you can make a molecule by bonding together different types of atoms. You can also get your bricks, stones, and wood back by taking the house apart just like you can get your atoms back by taking the molecule apart. No matter how hard you try, though, you can't turn bricks into wood. Converting common metals like copper into gold or iron into gold would be like turning bricks into wood – it's simply not possible. ==Matter Has Mass and Occupies Space== So far we've decided that the entire universe is composed of matter, which is in turn composed of atoms. Frequently, though, chemists want to know ''how much'' matter they actually have. To figure this out they rely on two fundamental properties of matter. All matter in the universe, from a teaspoon of salt to the Pacific Ocean, has mass and occupies space. When scientists measure how much space is taken up by a certain quantity of matter, they are measuring the object's ''volume''. Obviously, the volume of the Pacific Ocean is a lot larger than the volume of a teaspoon of salt. Unfortunately, while volume is an important property, and plays an important role in a lot of different chemical experiments, volume is not the best way to determine how much matter you have. Typically we think that the bigger something is, the more there is in it. That's certainly true a lot of the time in our everyday lives. If you pour yourself two cups of coffee in the morning, you'll be drinking twice as much coffee as you would have if you'd only poured yourself a single cup. Unfortunately, any time that we compare volumes in this way, we are making two assumptions that aren't always true in chemical experiments. First, we are assuming constant temperature. That's important, because the amount of space taken up by a certain quantity of matter depends on the temperature of that matter. In general, heating something up causes it to expand, and cooling something down causes it to contract. Secondly, when you compare volumes in everyday life, you are almost always comparing volumes of the same material. You can compare two cups of coffee to one cup of coffee, but how do you compare two cups of coffee to one cup of ice cream? It really doesn't make sense. Volume is not a good way to determine the quantity of matter that you have. If you can't use volume to figure out how much matter you've got, what can you use? It turns out that the best way to determine quantities of matter is to use a measure known as ''mass''. The mass of an object doesn't change with temperature, which makes it a lot easier to determine how much stuff you're dealing with, especially when you don't know what the temperature is or when the temperature keeps changing. Another good thing about mass is that an atom of a particular element always has the same mass (Strictly speaking that's not entirely true because of what are known as isotopes, but you won't need to worry about that now). For example, an atom of gold always has a mass of about 197 ''atomic mass units'' or ''daltons''. Atomic mass units are units that we use to measure mass, just like a mile is a unit that we use to measure distance, and an hour is a unit that we use to measure time. Even when atoms are bonded together into molecules, the individual atoms have the same mass, meaning that by adding up all of the masses of the atoms in a molecule, it's fairly easy to figure out the mass of the molecule itself. You'll eventually learn how to do this. ==The Difference Between Mass and Weight== [[File:Analytical balance mettler ae-260.jpg|200px|thumb|'''Figure 1.21''': The type of balance a chemist might use to measure the mass of an object.]] One typical mistake that students make when learning about mass for the first time is confusing mass with weight. Again, this confusion is largely due to the fact that, in everyday English, we frequently use the word "weight" when we actually mean "mass". For example, when you say "I want to lose weight", what you really mean is, "I want to lose mass". In science, the word "weight" has a very specific definition that is different from what you might expect. Do not confuse the everyday meaning of the word "weight" with the scientific meaning of the word "weight" (Figure 1.21). In science, '''mass''' is an intrinsic ("built-in") property of matter. The mass of an atom is the same regardless of the temperature or the other atoms that are bonded to it. Similarly, the mass of an atom doesn't change depending on where it is. The mass of an atom is the same on Earth as it would be on the moon, or on Jupiter, or in the middle of space. Weight, on the other hand, does change with location. An object that weighs 240 pounds on earth would weigh about 40 pounds on the moon and that same object in a spaceship far away from any large mass would weigh zero (Figure 1.22). In all three cases, however, the object would have exactly the same mass. [[File:CK-12 spaceship.png|500px|center|thumb|'''Figure 1.22''': With no large mass nearby, this spaceship is weightless.]] In science, '''weight''' is a measurement of how strongly gravity pulls on an object. Weight depends on both the mass of the object and the force of gravity the object is experiencing. That's why your weight changes depending on where you're standing. In each case, your mass will be the same, but the force of gravity on Earth is different than the force of gravity on the moon, or on Jupiter and, as a result, your weight is different too. The force of gravity, however, doesn't change significantly on the surface of Earth. In other words, the force of gravity in California is approximately the same as the force of gravity in Australia. As a result, as long as you stick to the surface of the Earth, the more massive an object is, the more it weighs. ==Lesson Summary== * All physical objects are made of matter. * Matter itself is composed of tiny building blocks known as "atoms". There are only 118 different types of atoms known to man. * Frequently, atoms are bonded together to form "molecules". * All matter has mass and occupies space. * Volume is a measure of how much space an object occupies. Volume is not a good measure of how much matter makes up any given object. * Mass is an intrinsic property of matter that does not depend on temperature, location, or the way in which the matter is organized (how the atoms are bonded) As a result, mass is an excellent measure of how much matter is in any given object. * "Mass" and "weight" have two very different scientific meanings. * "Mass" only depends on how much matter is in an object. "Weight", on the other hand, depends on how strongly gravity pulls on an object. ==Review Questions== # What is matter? # What does weight mean? # In this chapter, we'll learn about atoms, which are the building blocks of all matter in the universe. As of 2011, scientists only know of 118 different types of atoms. How do you think it's possible to generate so many different forms of matter using only 118 types of building blocks? # Which do you think has more matter, a cup of water or a cup of mercury? Explain. # Decide whether each of the following statements is true or false. #: (a) Mass and weight are two words for the same concept. #: (b) Molecules are bonded together to form atoms. #: (c) Alchemists couldn't make gold out of common metals because gold is an element. #: (d) The symbol for Gold in the periodic table is Gd. # Would you have more mass on the moon or on Earth? # Would you have more weight on the moon or on Earth? The force of gravity is stronger on the Earth than it is on the moon. # Match the following terms with their meaning. #:
(a) Massa. a measure of the total quantity of matter in an object
(b) Volumeb. a measure of how strongly gravity pulls on an object
(c) Weightc. a measure of the space occupied by an object
# For the following statements, circle all of the options that apply: #* Mass depends on… #*: (a) the total quantity of matter #*: (b) the temperature #*: (c) the location #*: (d) the force of gravity #* Volume depends on… #*: (a) the total quantity of matter #*: (b) the temperature #*: (c) the object's shape (independent of size) #*: (d) the object's size (independent of shape) #* Weight depends on… #*: (a) the total quantity of matter #*: (b) the temperature #*: (c) the location #*: (d) the force of gravity ==Vocabulary== ; atom : The basic building block of all matter. There are 118 known types of atoms. While atoms can be broken down into particles known as electrons, protons and neutrons, this is very difficult to do. ; element : A type of atom. There are 118 known elements. ; matter : Anything of substance that has mass and occupies space. ; molecule : Two or more atoms bonded together. Specific molecules, like water, have distinct characteristics. ; mass : An intrinsic property of matter that can be used to measure the quantity of matter present in a sample. ; Periodic Table : A way of summarizing all the different atoms that scientists have discovered. Each square in the periodic table contains the symbol for one of the elements. ; volume : A measurement of how much space a substance occupies. ; weight : A measurement of how strongly gravity pulls on an object. {{chapnav|Chemistry is a Science of Materials|Energy}}
